intro: Clibadium lanceolatum, commonly known as the African arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its roots are thick and tuberous, which are used as a starchy food source. The plant is often grown for its edible roots and has traditional medicinal uses in some regions.
